title: Introduction - Network analysis of armed conflict
contents:
Armed conflicts network
analysis
The objective of this project is to use network analysis methods to
examine armed conflicts data. Conflict, from interpersonal disputes to
armed conflicts between states, has always been an inherent part of
human civilization at some level. This is especially relevant today, as
recent world events serve as an extremely unpleasant reminder of the
tragic destruction of human life and livelihood due to armed conflicts.
This project aims to analyze historical data on armed and violent
conflicts in the time period from 1946 - 2020.
Data source
This project uses the Uppsala Conflict Data Program’s (UCDP) Dyadic
Dataset, a project within the UCDP at the Department of Peace and
Conflict Research, Uppsala University. The UCDP Dyadic dataset builds on
the UCDP/PRIO Armed Conflict dataset, by focusing on individual dyads
within each conflict. For the purpose of data collection, state-based
armed conflict is defined as: “a contested incompatibility that concerns
government and/or territory where the use of armed force between two
parties, of which at least one is the government of a state, results in
at least 25 battle-related deaths in a calendar year”
